hipi.imagebundle
Class AbstractImageBundle

java.lang.Object
  hipi.imagebundle.AbstractImageBundle
Direct Known Subclasses:
HARImageBundle, HipiImageBundle, SeqImageBundle
public abstract class AbstractImageBundle
extends java.lang.Object

Base class for all image bundles in HIPI. All subclasses must implement methods to open, read, and close the image bundles. This class can also be used to write an image bundle but image bundles have to read and written sequentially. Thus, in order to create an image bundle, you have to open a new file and then write the entire contents. Once you have opened the file you cannot read anything from the file until you have closed it.

open

public final void open(int mode,
                       boolean overwrite)
                throws java.io.IOException
Opens a file for either reading or writing. This method will return an IOException if an open call has already happened.

Parameters:
mode - determines whether the file will be read from or written to
overwrite - if the file exists and this is a write operation, this parameter determines whether to delete the file first or throw an error
Throws:
java.io.IOException

openForWrite

protected abstract void openForWrite()
                              throws java.io.IOException
Method for opening a file for the purposes of writing. The function open(int) contains the necessary checks to determine whether a file can be opened for writing.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

addImage

public final void addImage(FloatImage image)

protected abstract boolean prepareNext()
Reads the next image and stores it in a cache. Does not decode the image from the image bundle

Returns:
denote if has next or not

readHeader

protected abstract ImageHeader readHeader()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Returns:
the decoded ImageHeader from the cache that has been prepared. Will not advance the bundle to the next image upon return
Throws:
java.io.IOException

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
Returns:

close

public abstract void close()
                    throws java.io.IOException
Closes the underlying stream for this bundle. In some implementations, no data is written to the output stream unless this function is called.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
